subject: SOC
title: Spirituality, Secularity, and Religion in Sociological Perspective
description: This course examines the nature of religion, spirituality, and non-religion in society and their impact on many aspects of social and political life in North America and Europe. We will also consider how religion, spirituality, and non-religion can be sources of social stability and peace as well as of social change and conflict. [Note: This course fulfils an Area 3 requirement for Religious Studies majors.]
